– in the then

Nigeria
– during British colonial times .

King Josaiah Ndubuisi Wachuku belonged to the Royal
House
of Ebii ; which , in
Igbo language
, is specifically called : Ụmụ Ebii ; meaning : Children of Ebii .
In recent history , the Royal House of Ụmụ Ebii is headed by the eldest living son of King Josaiah Ndubuisi Wachuku .

Currently , Barrister : Sir Chikezie Ndubuisi Wachuku is Head of Ụmụ Ebii Royal House .
[ 1 ]
[ 2 ]
[ 3 ]
[ 4 ]
In royal lineage , King Josaiah Ndubuisi Wachuku , whose brothers were : James Wachuku and Marcus Wachuku , was the son of Wachuku : Ọgbaregbe : Ebii : Mkpeyi : Chekwa : Megwa : Mgbawa , etc.
King Josaiah Ndubuisi Wachuku 's apogean royal ancestor , Mgbawa , had moved from Umụlọlọ : Eziama Ntịgha :

: Nigeria , in about the last quarter of the 17th century ; to settle in their current Nbawsi native land .
[ 5 ]
[ 6 ]

Crucially , royal wives and queens of King Josaiah Ndubuisi Wachuku were : Rebecca Ngwanchiwa Josaiah Ndubuisi Wachuku , ... , Elizabeth Josaiah Ndubuisi Wachuku , Mercy Josaiah Ndubuisi Wachuku , Mary Josaiah Ndubuisi Wachuku , Dorcas Josaiah Ndubuisi Wachuku , Nwannediya Josaiah Ndubuisi Wachuku .
[ 7 ]
While he served Ngwa people , Igboland , Commonwealth of Nations and humankind , King Josaiah Ndubuisi Wachuku empowered women and less privileged persons in Ngwaland and beyond .

Women were given vital voice and platform to state their needs and share their viable vision for sustainable development , family values , education , healthcare , energy , mechanization , technology , creativity , innovation , infrastructure , industrialization , democratic politics , servant leadership , trade , financial inclusion , environment , sustainability , agriculture , land ownership , legal representation , peace , human rights and fairness ; including during Nsulu Women 's protest ; that started on Saturday 3 January 1948 ; concerning King Josaiah Ndubuisi Wachuku 's " palm oil plantations , machines for cracking kernels and PMOs : Pioneer Oil Mills ; " which King Josaiah Ndubuisi Wachuku 's second son : Prince
Jaja Wachuku
; " who had returned from Ireland in 1947 ; after graduating from
University of Dublin
as a lawyer ; " helped resolve by serving to humanely support those protesting women , legally and financially .
[ 8 ]
[ 9 ]
[ 10 ]
Accordingly , King Josaiah Ndubuisi Wachuku was the father of 10 daughters and 18 sons .

Daughters of King Josaiah Ndubuisi Wachuku are : Agnes Wachuku : Mrs. Agnes Francis Nwokedi , Ugbọakụ Wachuku , Awụsakụ Wachuku , Rose Wachuku : Mrs. Rose Akparanta , Nwaọlụchi Wachuku , Nwaozichi Wachuku : Mrs. Nwaozichi Okey , Chima Wachuku : Mrs. Chima Nnamji , Catherine Wachuku , Nwanyieze Wachuku : Mrs. Nwanyieze Onuorah , Ulọakụ Wachuku .

Eighteen sons of King Josaiah Ndubuisi Wachuku are : Albert Wachuku , Jaja Wachuku , Benjamin Wachuku , Jonah Wachuku , Chikezie Wachuku , Ibe : Ibemaduabughịchi Wachuku , Alọzie Wachuku , Eguzoikpe Wachuku , Ogbonna Wachuku , Madu : Maduadighịbeyanma Wachuku , Victor Wachuku , ON : Ọnwụnyịriụwa Wachuku , Joseph Wachuku , Timothy Wachuku , Onweremadu Wachuku , Alibọr Wachuku , Chivọr Wachuku , Evo Wachuku ; and notably , his second son :
Jaja Wachuku
, was first indigenous speaker of the
House of Representatives of Nigeria
, first Nigerian ambassador and
permanent representative
to the
United Nations
; as well as first Nigerian minister for foreign affairs and
commonwealth
relations .

Royal Merchant Prince Wachuku Ọgbaregbe was King Josaiah Ndubuisi Wachuku 's father .
Wachuku 's children were : Josaiah , James , Marcus , Nmaji and Janet .

Wachuku 's second Son : James Nwanjoku Wachuku 's sons are : Young Wachuku , Nnanna Wachuku , Adiele Wachuku , Eze Wachuku , Willie Wachuku , Goddy Wachuku ; and James ' daughters are : Ulọma , Margaret , Nwaobilo , Omeonu , Chinyere , Uzuka , Kaka , Dora , Dinah and others .

Wachuku 's third son : Marcus Nwogu Wachuku 's sons are : Franklin Wachuku , Fanso Wachuku , Uche Nathan Wachuku , Chijioke Wachuku , Ike Wachuku ; and Marcus ' daughters are : Chiọma , Nwandiụto , Ugbọmma ; including grandchildren and great-grandchildren from brothers and sisters of King Josaiah Ndubuisi Wachuku ; who comes from 19 generations of royal chiefs in " Igbo country of Eastern Nigeria .

Going the way of all humankind , King Josaiah Ndubuisi Wachuku died on Monday 2 January 1950 at General Hospital
Aba
Ngwa ; following a necessary operation .

His death caused angry protests by Ngwa people ; against doctors who performed operation on him .
